alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Grand Isle; Lamoille; Orleans; Western Franklin (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 3:48PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Lamoille, northwestern Orleans, northeastern Grand Isle and Franklin Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 348 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Highgate, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Enosburg Falls, Franklin, Jay, Jay In Franklin County, Swanton Village, Bakersfield, Berkshire, Highgate Falls, Montgomery Center, Montgomery, Sheldon, Lake Carmi State Park, Enosburg, Swanton, North Troy Village, Richford, Highgate, Enosburg Falls Village, Fletcher, and Fairfield. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 115 and 130. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Franklin; Grand Isle; Lamoille; Orleans; Western Franklin
